name: my_strdup
description: Write a function that allocates memory and copies the string given as argument in it.

name: concat_params
description: Write a function that turns the command-line given arguments into a single string. Arguments are to be separated by ‘ ’.

name: my_show_word_array
description: Write a function that displays the content of an array of words. There must be one word per line, and each word must end with ‘ ’, including the last one

name: my_str_to_word_array
description: Write a function that splits a string into words. Separators will all be non-alphanumeric characters. The function returns an array in which each cell contains the address of a string (representing a word). The last cell must be null to terminate the array

name: convert_base
prototype: char *convert_base(char const *nbr, char const *base_from, char const *base_to);
description: Write a function that returns the result from the nbr string conversion (expressed in a base_from radix to a base_to radix), in the form of a newly, and sufficiently, allocated string. The number, represented by nbr, fits in an integer
